commit.message:
Initial http UI for fortio (#10)

* New Histogram.Export() that returns the data in consumable form

Plus a couple more Makefile targets for testing/installing
Changed Periodic return correspondingly

Example output:
```
{
  "DurationHistogram": {
    "Count": 40,
    "Min": 0.054895218,
    "Max": 0.153494493,
    "Sum": 3.145985655,
    "Avg": 0.078649641375,
    "StdDev": 0.02462510369930899,
    "Data": [
      {
        "Start": 0.054895218,
        "End": 0.06,
        "Percent": 15,
        "Count": 6
      },
      {
        "Start": 0.06,
        "End": 0.07,
        "Percent": 50,
        "Count": 14
      },
      {
        "Start": 0.07,
        "End": 0.08,
        "Percent": 77.5,
        "Count": 11
      },
      {
        "Start": 0.08,
        "End": 0.09,
        "Percent": 80,
        "Count": 1
      },
      {
        "Start": 0.1,
        "End": 0.12,
        "Percent": 92.5,
        "Count": 5
      },
      {
        "Start": 0.12,
        "End": 0.14,
        "Percent": 95,
        "Count": 1
      },
      {
        "Start": 0.14,
        "End": 0.153494493,
        "Percent": 100,
        "Count": 2
      }
    ],
    "Percentiles": [
      {
        "Percentile": 50,
        "Value": 0.07
      },
      {
        "Percentile": 75,
        "Value": 0.0790909090909091
      },
      {
        "Percentile": 99,
        "Value": 0.1507955944
      },
      {
        "Percentile": 99.9,
        "Value": 0.15322460314000003
      }
    ]
  },
  "ActualQPS": 7.895627575902356,
  "ActualDuration": 5066095078
}
```

```release-note
Fortio now supports exporting the data in programmatically consumable
form - and the command line can use -json path to export in json
```

* Initial version of an http 'UI'

* Setoutput file, Put the version in the json output

So if we store it in some DB it can be normalized/schema upgraded as
format changes

Moved the Version in periodic from fhttp as a result. (Semi
incompatible change)

New Out option to set where the output goes (to be used by UI too) also
allows to send the Json to stdout using -json -

Fixed typo in Makefile

* Wip somehow crashes the tests

* Also capture result codes and size histograms in the json

* Fix the crash

* Full JSON out + fixed logging

* Fix bug/crash when changing to io.Writer

kinda strange it doesn’t show up with os.File

* Added the most useful fortio load params

Added the most useful fortio load params and Json only mode option

Also restore ^C after runs

* Code review comments

Thx ymesika

* Linter fixes

* Fix linter errors

* Adding todo about headers

* Added headers support

note: the server is somewhat stateful right now which isn’t a good
thing (not protected writes to headers for instance)

* Forgot to remove that 1 todo

* Moved ui stuff out of fhttp

Also added a test for RoundDuration

* Adding logo and color bg

* English lint/typo fix

Initial http UI for fortio (#10)

* New Histogram.Export() that returns the data in consumable form

Plus a couple more Makefile targets for testing/installing
Changed Periodic return correspondingly

```release-note
Fortio now supports exporting the data in programmatically consumable
form - and the command line can use -json path to export in json
```

* Initial version of an http 'UI'

* Setoutput file, Put the version in the json output

So if we store it in some DB it can be normalized/schema upgraded as
format changes

Moved the Version in periodic from fhttp as a result. (Semi
incompatible change)

New Out option to set where the output goes (to be used by UI too) also
allows to send the Json to stdout using -json -

Fixed typo in Makefile

* Wip somehow crashes the tests

* Also capture result codes and size histograms in the json

* Fix the crash

* Full JSON out + fixed logging

* Fix bug/crash when changing to io.Writer

kinda strange it doesn’t show up with os.File

* Added the most useful fortio load params

Added the most useful fortio load params and Json only mode option

Also restore ^C after runs

* Code review comments

Thx ymesika

* Linter fixes

* Fix linter errors

* Adding todo about headers

* Added headers support

note: the server is somewhat stateful right now which isn’t a good
thing (not protected writes to headers for instance)

* Forgot to remove that 1 todo

* Moved ui stuff out of fhttp

Also added a test for RoundDuration

* Adding logo and color bg

* English lint/typo fix
